There is a quantity of statistical datasets in Argentina collected by the Instituto Nacional de Estadística y Censos (1). Even though these data in not available in open formats. Some economical datasets have been observed more than once by international institutions such as the International Monetary Fund. In this case the IMF has issued a declaration of censorship and called on Argentina to adopt remedial measures to address the quality of official GDP and consumer price index data.

##Sources:

(1): http://www.indec.mecon.ar

Census data (1)
(1): http://www.censo2010.indec.gov.ar/

Economic census (2)

There is data which is in charge of the Oficina Nacional de Presupuesto (1), that has place in the Secretaría de Hacienda, a part of the Ministerio de Economía y Finanzas Públicas. However, since the data is contained in written documents, it is really hard to obtain it.

There is data on government spend at the Oficina Nacional de Presupuesto, that has place in the Secretaría de Hacienda, a part of the Ministerio de Economía y Finanzas Públicas.

The Instituto Nacional de Estadística y Censos counts with more detailed data, according to the categories determined by the law of budget.

Since the data is contained in written documents is really hard to obtain it (1). There are some more detailed reports but they are complete to 2009 (2).

Theres is a lot of data collected but a great part of it is not shared, or in some cases it is accessible internally. There is a Unity of Monitoring within the Subsecretaría del Comercio Exterior (Ministerio de Economía y Finanzas Públicas) that has the legal mandate of providing updated information on foreign trade to different areas of the Ministry of Foreign Trade. In fact it mentions they have developed various tech tools for information management, allowing easy and dynamic access to data on foreign trade within the Secretariat and other areas of the Ministry. It produces some data that is shared through the Instituto Nacional de Estadística y Censos as reports.

INDEC provides a map (1) showing theorigin and destination of products exported.

There are databases collected from different governmental institutions. On one hand there are all the provincial authorities of the Dirección Nacional de Política Criminal (Ministerio de Justicia), which inform and produce a national database. This data refers to certain types of crimes and in not up to date (last report dates from 2012).

There are also some databases produced by government and shared between public bodies in charge of security but not publicly. This is the case of the Dirección Nacional de Gestión de la Información Criminal (Ministerio de Seguridad)

There is environmental statistics data available, but the most part of it, even if it is shared, in not updated. The principal responsible for this type of data is the Dirección de Impacto Ambiental y Social (1), part of the Secretaría Ambiente y Desarrollo Sustentable de la Nación. They have various statistic (not updated) and they have developed the Sistema de Indicadores de Desarrollo Sostenible, but even these are out of date.

There is also some of these data, in the national level, in the hands of the Ministerio de Agricultura, Ganadería y Pesca (2) and at the Subsecretaría de Recursos Hídricos, but the latter asks for personal information in order to provide the data (3). Also at the provincial level there are the environmental or sustainable development offices that owe their own data.

Austrian Ministry of Health
Supporting4:
A number of performance indexes such as A-IQI (Austrian Inpatient Quality Index) exist (1), but are in the stage of development and data is not available outside of the profession. Other data such as the Austrian Health Information System (ÖGIS) only is available on a paid basis (2). Furthermore, a quality system with a platform for hospitals also exists - however, it is not intended for public access either. (3)

In general, the Austrian Ministry of Health is in charge of such projects.

Statistics Austria features some data, such as on the self-perceived health (4) or healthy years of life (5), but the data is more than eight years old in case (4) and may not be fully used.

Federal Criminal Police (Bundeskriminalamt)
Federal Ministry of the Interior (Bundesministerium für Inneres)
Supporting4:
The Federal Criminal Police Office collects and aggregates data on various crime subjects. Interestingly, only very brief summaries are published under the subject Crime Statistics (Polizeiliche Kriminalstatistik, PKS) (1) - essentially it's a 6 page press release with on big table summing up the annual development in the entire country and the federal states. (2)
However, the statistics overview page (but not the one for 2013) features a link the "Security Report" by the Ministry of the Interior (Sicherheitsbericht 2013; Kriminalitätsbericht - Statistik und Analyse). It contains very many details on reported crimes, also breaking them down on the federal state level, on over 250 PDF pages. (3)
The Criminal Verdict Statistics by Statistics Austria delivers more detail, but only for the whole country, no federal states or even more granular levels such as counties (4).

The Federal Environmental Office (Umweltbundesamt) publishes a number of datasets on the national data portal data.gv.at. These include ozone data, various maps, shapes of national parks, an inventory of wetlands and data on biological diversity (1). 
On the site of the Environmental Office, detailed data from air quality monitoring stations can be found (2).

"The Tender Board is a fully independent body, established by a Royal Decree on 7 January 2003". The US Dept of State Investment Climate Statement for Bahrain complements: "In October 2002, Bahrain implemented a new government procurement law that establishes the basic framework for a transparent, rules-based government procurement system. It provides that certain procurements may be conducted as international public tenders open to foreign suppliers. To implement this law, a tender board chaired by a Minister of State was established in January 2003 to oversee all government tenders and purchases."
(http://www.state.gov/e/eb/rls/othr/ics/2012/191105.htm)

The Tender Board has a list of opened, to be opened, closed and awarded tenders. The data is not published according to the terms of the Open Definition though. I have also chosen to select "data collected but not shared" as the information available is very limited (name of company and amount of tender funding) and not always up-to-date (for ex., the latest listing of awarded tenders is from June 2014).

The Belgian mapping agency provides digital map data in vector format in different scales (1:10000, 1:50000, 1:250000). Respective products are known as Top10Vector, Top50Vector and Top250Vector (1). Data includes roads, railways and other important infrastructures. Administrative boundaries are available in another product named AdminVector and available in 1:10000 scale (2).

The data are published under a dedicated license entitled "Licence Open Data". This license grants the license holder the right to share, modify and use the data. However some conditions restrict the use of the data. For instance Article 2.1 states that: "The license holder can not reuse the data for a distinct purpose from the one mentioned when registering to download the files". This is not compliant with an Open Data licence.

The Autonomous Electoral National Commission CENA
Supporting1: The Autonomous Electoral National Commission CENA, is the board that organizes national elections, centralizes and publishes elections results on its web site and then transfer them to the Constitutional Court which is the only one to validate the results. A new CENA is always installed in the event of an electional to national assembly or municipalities. So results data are just available when there is an election. The results data are not held by the government, there are shared but not as open data. There is no data for the study period.
Supporting2: The Autonomous Electoral National Commission CENA is mandated by the law to share the results data with the press, government, the Constitutional court and other third parties like political parties or groups of political parties.However the dedicated website to national elections Beninelections.com provided regular details elections results during the last presidential and legislatives elections.

No details of when and where public transport services such as buses and rail services are expected to run exist nor a national dataset even for the key cities of Cotonou and Porto-Novo. There a no such organized public transport providers in the Country nor formal public transport lines operated by the government. Only GSM operators provide planes schedules via some added value services.
Supporting2: NO. there is no evidence that government is requiring third-party sharing of this kind of data. The numerous private companies of public transport do not provide this kind of data online. People have to go to the companies' offices to have a clear idea of schedules, departures and arrivals and conditions for carrying goods or persons.

Ministry of Lands and Housing through The Department of Surveys and Mapping (DSM)
Supporting4:
Data is not available online. However, The Department of Surveys and Mapping is the main national mapping organization of the country.  The major function of the Department is the collection, management and dissemination of geo-spatial data using technologies such as: surveying, mapping, remote sensing and geographic information system.  Besides, being a specialized organization, it provides professional services and advice to Government, parastatals and the private sector on all matters related to above technologies and efficient use of geo-spatial data.

The Mapping Division is responsible for National Mapping Programme using modern technology.  Production is carried out in-house and through contract services.  It provides topographic maps at small, medium and large scales in analogue as well as digital format and special services such as thematic maps (tourist maps, city/town plans, election maps etc.), aerial photographs and remote sensing data.  The Division has acquired a number of advanced Photogrammetric and Cartographic systems to augment the production flow in mapping.  It is also responsible for the Geographic Place Names Act.

Ministry of Lands and Housing through the department of deeds registry. 

The Deeds Registry takes charge and preserves records registered in the Deeds Registry. Its main function is to register title to surveyed or demarcated pieces of land, owned by the state, individuals and other entities capable of owning land or real rights in land. The division therefore plays a central role in the land registration system of the country and is thus the main source of information regarding land ownership and other real rights attaching to it - http://www.mlh.gov.bw/index.php?option=com_departments&id=29

The Burkinabè STMB and TCV companies operate transport bus nationwide and connect to other countries. There are other foreign buses companies operating in the country such as STC from Ghana or SNTV from Niger (1). SOTRACO operates  transport bus in the capital Ouagadougou. There is a train line between Ouadougou and Adbidjan (Ivory-Coast) operated by SITARAIL (Bolloré Group).

The Chamber for commerce, industry, mining and craft (CCIMA) is responsible for the collection and diffusion of information on companies in Cameroon (1). The eRegulation service maintained by the Ministry of SMEs, Solidarity Economy and Crafts (MINPMEESA) offers information for registration for specific councils but there is no centralized process yet (2). A project on the creation of a central database was mentioned in a 2009 report but there is no evidence such an exhaustive register is operational (3). Finally, the Statistics Institute conducted a Census of Companies in 2009 but it does not provide the list of the companies, the results provided are only about statistics on these companies (4).

(1) CCIMA, http://www.ccima.net/present_fr.php Accessed on 2014-07-03
(2) Cameroon eRegulations, http://cameroun.eregulations.org/ Accessed on 2014-07-03
(3) Observatoire Economique et Statistique d’Afrique Subsaharienne, Atelier sur le traitement des statistiques d’entreprises, February 2009, http://www.afristat.org/contenu/doc_travail_experts/Com_Repertoire-Final_publication.pdf Accessed on 2014-07-03
(4) INS Cameroun, Recensement Général des Entreprises (RGE2009),http://www.statistics-cameroon.org/news.php?id=78 Accessed on 2014-09-09
Supporting1:
There are some lists of companies that are shared but these lists are not complete at all. The Chamber for commerce, industry, mining and craft (CCIMA) maintains a database on industrial companies in the country. The database only have 63 companies registered though. It is possible to export the data in Excel file (1). The CCIMA also provides another listing on its website (1) but there are less than 400 companies available and there is no possibility to export the data easily.

There are several websites and agencias in charge of map data. Maybe the most traditional one is the Geographic Military Institute (1), in charge of cartographic information. It is important to note that most of the maps created by IGM are sold and not open. IDE (Infraestructura de Datos Espaciales, Spatial Data Infrastructure is an agency dependent of the Ministry of National Goods focused on managing geospatial data. They provide geographical information via GIS systems (3). It is not clear the relation between IDE and IGM. Finally, some geographic data (e.g., latitude/longitude of schools) is available at the Chilean Data Portal (4).

##Sources

(2): http://www.ide.cl

(4): http://datos.gob.cl/

In Chile, land data is registered in a local agency related to each city or municipality. Most of them do not provides data available on the Web. Those that have incorporated more intense use of technology merely allow for making online requests for copies of documents (2).

A secondary source of land ownership data is the tax administration, but, leaving aside its lack of accuracy, that data is used for internal purposes of the tax administration, thus is, for collecting tax related to tenancy of real states (3).

##Sources

(1): http://www.conservadores.cl/paginas/asp/nomina.asp
(2): See e.g. Registrar of Real State of Santiago at http://www.chileatiende.cl/fichas/ver/436
(3): http://home.sii.cl/
Not apply.

The National Institute of Statistics has released the 2002 census data (1). In 2012, a new census took place. However, because of serious technical deficiencies on the census itself, including the omission of a significant amount of the population, in March 2014, data related to that census has became inaccesible (2). The new government that took office in March 2014 has announced the elaboration of a new census in 2017 (3).

Other statistics are collected regularly, including inflation, unemployment, etc. In 2013, some people criticized the CASEN household survey (4), accusing the government of manipulating and misinterpreting the data.

For creating a companies, contracting parties must sign a contract before a notary, register the information before a registrar, and publish a brief of the contract into the official gazette. Ultimately, for becoming operative, a company must get a national ID number before the tax administration.

The official gazette offers a limited search mechanism (1) where it is possible to obtain an extract of the contract that creates the company. This search is limited, since the user must know the day, month and year when the company was published, as well as the type of the company.

(1) http://www.diariooficial.interior.gob.cl/sociedades-web/

The Environment Ministry processes national environmental statistics data on carbon emissions, levels of pollution, and deforestation, among others. However, data is not share as open data. Part of the data has been released through studies, among which it must be highlighted a 2011 Government Report on Environment (1), a bilingual report that includes statistics on different kind of pollution, as well as biodiversity. But data is shown in a pdf format. Other data could be retrieve through individual queries, such as that related to carbon emissions in the capital city (2).  

##Sources

(2): http://registro-nh3.mma.gob.cl/paginas/index.php

Also, some data related to air quality is available via webapps such as http://www.mma.gob.cl/1304/w3-propertyvalue-16214.html

However, it does not provide access to open data on public contracting. Data on a given specific transaction could be accessed online after a previous subscription. A limited set of data on 2012 transactions is available inthe government's website on open data, however (3).

The Ministry of Land and Resources of the People's Republic of China is responsible for collecting and managing property registration (1).

#Sources
(1) http://www.mlr.gov.cn Accessed on 2014-10-16
Supporting4:
Data is collected but is not online. More precisely, the Ministry of Land and Resources recently announced that a nationwide property registry, as well as the platform for information management, will be operational before 2018 (1) and officially built the Department of Homeland Real Estate Registration Office on May 8, 2014 (2). The registration data was previously collected by various ministries and will be unified under the new registry (2). Previous registration data is also incomplete often. For example, property developers complained about incomplete information about land zoning, saying some local authorities had sold massive amounts of land without considering a possible oversupply of housing and commercial development (1).

Sources: 
(1) Esther Fung, China gives timetable for national property registry, The Wall Street Journal, April 21 2014, http://online.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424052702304049904579515171780345790. Accessed June 10 2014

(2) 中华人民共和国国土资源部，《国土部不动产登记局正式挂牌》, May 09 2014. http://www.mlr.gov.cn/xwdt/mtsy/xinhuanet/201405/t20140509_1316433.htm. Accessed June 10 2014

National Bureau of Statistics of the People's Republic of China is responsible for the data (1)(2)

(1) Website can be found here: http://www.stats.gov.cn Accessed on 2014-10-16
(2) The detail of such responsibility can be found on its website stating terms of service, http://www.stats.gov.cn/wzgl/201310/t20131021_444713.html Accessed on 2014-10-16
Supporting4:
The National Bureau of Statistics provides standard statistics data in reusable format from the yearly yearbooks. The last general census of the population dates back to 2010 (1). Datasets can also be obtained from the national data portal including monthly, quarterly, yearly, census, and regional statistic data (2).

(3) http://www.gov.cn/flfg/index.htm Accessed on 2014-10-16
Supporting4: The General Office of the State Council of the People's Republic of China manages the Gazette of the State Council of the People's Republic of China which contains last laws and regulations. The Supreme People's Court of the People's Republic of China also publishes a Gazette which contains the national legislation, official documents, judicial interpretation and typical cases. Finally, the Central People's Government of People's Republic of China offers on its website laws and regulations of different administrative levels.

Supporting0: http://www.gov.cn/flfg/index.htm

The Ministry of Transport of the People's Republic of China is responsible for such data (1).

##Sources
(1) http://www.moc.gov.cn Accessed on 2014-10-16
Supporting4:
Data regarding city bus service, inter-city service, and subway service can be found in the passenger service information on the website of Ministry of Transport (1). It is organised based on each first-level administrative division. Data regarding these public transport timetables can be obtained by searching specific route but not available in bulk. 

Data regarding inter-city rail services can be found on the website of railway passenger service centre of the China Railway Bureau under the Ministry of Transport (2). Data regarding these public transport timetables can be obtained by searching specific route but not available in bulk.

##Sources
(1) http://www.moc.gov.cn/zhuzhan/yunshuguanli/ Accessed on 2014-10-17
(2) https://kyfw.12306.cn/otn/ Accessed on 2014-10-17

The Central Election Commission (1).

##Sources
(1) http://engweb.cec.gov.tw/bin/home.php Accessed on 2014-10-16
Supporting4:
Elections in the People's Republic of China are based on a hierarchical electoral system, whereby local People's Congresses are directly elected, and all higher levels of People's Congresses up to the National People's Congress, the national legislature, are indirectly elected by the People's Congress of the level immediately below (1). Elections results are provided online by the Central Election Commission (2).

##Sources
(1) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elections_in_the_People's_Republic_of_China Accessed on 2014-10-16
(2) http://engweb.cec.gov.tw/ezfiles/30/1030/img/144/2012.htm Accessed on 2014-10-16

The Ministry of Education of the People's Republic of China is responsible for the data (1).

##Sources
(1) http://www.moe.gov.cn Accessed on 2014-10-16
Supporting4: Data includes number of students and teachers, student: teacher ratio, rates of school attendance and teacher attendance. No data of test scores for pupils in national examinations is found. Data is in HTML format and not under open license;

Supporting0:
Primary and secondary education performance data can be obtained from the data index published on the website of the Ministry of Education (1). Data includes number of students and teachers, student: teacher ratio, rates of school attendance and teacher attendance. No data of test scores for pupils in national examinations is found. Data is in HTML format and not under open license; 

Yearly primary and secondary education data can also be obtained on the national data portal (2). Data can be downloaded as machine-readable spreadsheet (excel, CSV, etc.) but are not open data.

##Sources
(1) http://www.moe.gov.cn/publicfiles/business/htmlfiles/moe/s7567/index.html Accessed on 2014-10-16
(2) http://data.stats.gov.cn/workspace/index?m=hgnd (In the list of indicators on the left side select Education 教育) Accessed on 2014-10-16

The National Health and Family Planning Commission of the People's Republic of China is responsible for the data (1).

##Sources
(1) http://www.nhfpc.gov.cn Accessed on 2014-10-16
Supporting4:
Monthly, quarterly, and yearly health data indicators are released on the website of the National Health and Family Planning Commission (1), including number of health institutions, health service cost, number of patients, etc. The data is displayed in a combination of text and tables on its webpages. Data format is HTML. The data is not open licensed. However there is no data on the health system performance.

China Statistic Yearbook database listing yearly national health indicators from 1996 (note: 1995 statistics) to 2013 (note: 2012 statistics). Data can be downloaded as an Excel spreadsheet but it is not open licensed: 

Yearly health performance data can also be obtained on the national data portal (3) including health system performance but only at national and regional levels. Data includes numbers of medical and health institutions, health personnel, beds in health institutions per 10,000 ppl, incidents of infectious diseases and mortality, total expenditure, etc. Data can be downloaded as machine-readable spreadsheet (excel, CSV, etc.) but not open licensed.

The General Administration of Customs of the People's Republic of China is responsible for such data (1). 

##Sources
(1) http://www.customs.gov.cn/publish/portal0/tab49567/ Accessed on 2014-10-16
Supporting4:
Details of the import and export of specific commodities and balance of trade data against other countries can be found on the Customs Main Statistics webpage (1). The data is displayed as lists of import and export by commodity and country in tables on its webpages. Data format is HTML. The data is not open licensed; 

China Statistic Yearbook database listing yearly international trade data from 1996 (note: 1995 statistics) to 2013 (note: 2012 statistics) (2). Data can be downloaded as Excel spreadsheet but not open licensed ;

Monthly and yearly international trade data can also be obtained on the national data portal (3). Data can be downloaded as machine-readable spreadsheet (excel, CSV, etc.) but not open licensed.

The Statistical and Census National Institute (1) portal and the Central Bank(2) website have a lot of national statistical information, in regards to social, employment, economic, environmental, demographic and commerce information. Part of it is updated on a semiannual basis, and another part on a yearly basis. All the information is shared, however it is not shared on a open data format, but in excel files.

The Ministry of Housing (http://mbbl.dk/english), Urban and Rural Affairs was established after the last parliamentary elections in October 2011. The ministry is responsible for housing, including the real property data administration, urban development in both larger and smaller cities and of development in sparsely populated rural areas. The ministry is a part of the Danish "Basic data program". A part of this program is to coordinate between different registers that have used different definitions of the ownership term, based on the different needs of different registers/institutions. These different definitions will be consolidated into a general concept of real immovable property. The plan is to start distributing this coherent data through a new platform in 2015 where it will be free of use, with open licenses and available in bulk. See http://grunddata-ejendom-adresse.dk/delaftale1
Supporting4:
Currently, this data is partly available through two different servers, the OIS server and ESR (for public sector users or private users that need the data for public sector projects). Here is an example of how I can lookup my ownership of own house/land (as well as ownership of others) 

http://boligejer.dk/ejendomsdata-ois/0/10/0/0240%7C003566%7C706462.54%7C6181715.03

For private professional use, the data is available through the OIS server but there you have to pay marginal cost (to the distributor) while the data itself is free

Supporting0: http://boligejer.dk/ejendomsdata-ois/0/10

Supporting1: It is possible by means of a distribution agreement (with additional cost) http://boligejer.dk/distribution-af-data

Supporting0: Free access
Unclear. For example marketing usage is prohibited.

Estonian Land Board
Supporting1: Estonian Land Board offers besides Web Map Server other spatial data services and information about maps and spatial data as well as data ordering information. There is all data from local government and central government which processed to comply with European Union INSPIRE directive.
Supporting2:
In short, yes.
Ordinary user can search, view and download spatial data in the geoportal.
Authenticated, i.e. registered  (ordinary) user can add to the geoportal his/her own data layers by digitising or uploading the existing spatial data, and share these layers with others.
Authenticated data owners are the holders of information as defined in §5 of the Public Information Act, and third persons, who provide services as listed in §7 of the Geoportal Regulation in order to meet the requirements of the INSPIRE Directive and Spatial Data Act, in particular those relating to metadata, interoperability and network services.
Supporting4: Extensive digital maps and map dataset, being the largest state map producer and administrator of spatial data. It is possible to browse backdrop maps and data layers and by combining them to create different thematic maps. The created maps can be shared or printed. User registration provides additional capabilities for adding, managing and sharing your own data layers. In 2008, Web-based map services (WMS) were added to the public map server; the Land Board’s maps can be accessed through these services using various GIS/CAD software.

The e-Land Register
Supporting4:
A convenient accessible service which allows quick and easy verification of general data, size, owners, restrictions and encumbering mortgages of immovable properties. 
Accessing the land register as a citizen enables to view the land register documents is free of charge. Authentication of a person via ID card or an Internet bank link is required in order to use the service. Contractual users have access to the e-land register, e-commercial register, the European Business Register and the Visualised Business Register. In order to use the service one has to log in with a user name and a password or with an ID card. It is possible to mandate (share) data viewing rights to other identified parties.
There are XML services: a person’s immovable properties, detailed data about an immovable property, immovable properties in a cadastre unit.

Ministry of Employment and the Economy, www.tem.fi
Supporting4:
Foreign Trade Statistics
Foreign Trade Statistics describes the commodity trade between Finland and other Member States of the European Union (EU) and between Finland and Third Countries i.e. the internal and external trade. Foreign Trade Statistics is the official information source on the importation, exportation, and balance of trade of Finland.

The goods statistics in Uljas are presented in accordance with
- CN: The Combined Nomenclature, of the EU

- SITC: The Standard International Trade Classification

- CPA: Classification of Products by Activities

- NACE: National industrial classification based on Statistical Classification of Economic Activities in the European Community (Nomenclature générale des Activités économiques dans les Communautés européennes, NACE).

Due to the federal state system, there is no national dataset. Each federal state maintains its own dataset. The data is not publicly available due to revenue and privacy reasons.
In June 2013, the G8 nations published the Open Data Charter, which appears promising for Germany and France in terms of cadastre data. It is supposed to be published within two years (=2015), but until now no publicly noticeable action has taken place. For instance, a national action plan was supposed to be published until the end of 2013, which first happened on 2014-09-17. Also, no German version of the Charter existed until the end of 2013. Partly this can be explained with the delay caused by the national elections in September 2013 and the resulting coalitions negotiations.

Supporting0: The Federal Environment Agency
Supporting4:
The Agency maintains a vast number of datasets, which it has reorganized on its website in a dedicated data sub-site (1). Yet it does not meet the expectations of a repository, because very many entries are just text with a few numbers in it. Still, data for instance on particulate matter (2) in the air can be found there in Excel formats. Other air quality data is only downloadable in CSV format on a daily basis, so downloading values for an entire year would be very difficult (3).

The other site for researching data is Portal U, which is basically a meta site. It bundles all the different data sources all over Germany. This is an advantage and disadvantage at the same time, as on still faces the shortcomings of individual sites. In particular, no verdict can be made on the license, as it differs for each source site (4).

The administrative boundaries are from December 31, 2013 - other datasets are from January 1, 2014. This has to do with the fact that revisions of admin boundaries usually take place on the first day of a new year.

The data is public and free to access as per the policy 

"The National Data Sharing and Accessibility Policy (NDSAP) is the policy which facilitates the access to Government of Ghana owned shareable data and information in both human readable and machine readable forms through Data Portal Ghana in a proactive and periodically updatable manner, within the framework of various related policies, Acts and rules of Government of Ghana, thereby, permitting wider accessibility and use of public data and information.

NDSAP will apply to all the data and information generated, collected and archieved using the public funds provided by Government of Ghana directly, with the help of various Ministries/ Departments/Organisations/ Agencies and Autonomous bodies"

The Transparency Program initiative (or Cl@rity) [https://et.diavgeia.gov.gr/en] is one of the major transparency initiatives of the Ministry of Administrative Reform and e-Governance [http://www.ydmed.gov.gr/?lang=en]. Henceforth, the decisions of the public entities (including government spending) can not be implemented if they are not uploaded through the Transparency Program.

Þjópskrá Íslands / Land Registry of Iceland [1] 

##Sources
[1] http://www.skra.is on 2014-11-3
Supporting4:
Ownership of land is currently not available as open data. Clarification answer from Katrín Hólm Hauksdóttir, Data processing, Geo-Information Department, Registers Iceland [1]: 
Today the registration of land is arranged in such a way that the new number of the property is registered in the database of the National Registry of Iceland and the ownership is the same as the prior registered owner of the land. This file is a text file and it is possible to buy the data. 
Statistics Iceland also defines land properties in a spatial database. The ownership of land is not part of these data, but it is possible to connect the demarcation of land to the registration of ownership. You can buy this dataset from Statistics Iceland. In the near future it is possible that data on land assets/properties (i.e. excluding the registration of ownership ) will be made available on opingogn.is
It is also possible to connect access address data to the ownership of land in the same way, there is a list of landowners down on each access address.
The ownership of land is not a part of the open records, partly because of privacy but additionally because Registers Iceland depends on their income from selling data. If, therefore, the register of land assets will be made available on opingogn.is the ownership of the land will not be part of the data.

Link to access address data: http://opingogn.is/is/dataset/stadfangaskra

[1] email Katrín Hólm Hauksdóttir, May 27 2014

Supporting0:

Supporting4: Registration with the Registrar of Companies, Ministry of Corporate Affairs, Government of India is only for those private limited or public limited companies that are registered under the Companies Act. This second set of data is not available at all, either as open data, or otherwise.

There is payment made in order to access land ownership data. It is reported that Official Search - An Application Form 11 is submitted by post to the Office and is conducted and checked by Registry Officials, the results will be issued by post. The fee is €20 per name, for each specified lands or premises, for each period of ten years or part thereof.


Hand Search  - A Hand Search is carried out by attending the office.  The fee is €2 per name, for each specified lands or premises, for each period of ten years or part thereof.

Online  - Registry of Deeds online searching is available to all landdirect.ie business account holders. Users are now able to search our records online from 1970 to date and will also be able to order Official Searches and Copy Memorials/Application Forms online. (Non-account holders may access these records at the Public Office in the Registry of Deeds.)

Italian Ministry of Health (www.salute.gov.it)
Supporting4: In Italy, hospital discharge records (SDO, Scheda di Dimissione Ospedaliera) are one of the main sources of information concerning health data. Every hospital fills in and sends to its own region a SDO record for each patient admitted to the hospital. Supporting4:
Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism Land is responsible for the National Land Survey (1). Regardind data collection, Municipalities are responsible for the registration of their Land Survey and the resulting data are integrated into the National Spatial Data Infrastructure (2) managed by the Geospatial Information Authority. Cadastral parcel boundaries constitute one of the layers available with the map data and can be therefore downloaded from the Geospatial Information Authority website at http://fgd.gsi.go.jp/download/ (registration needed). There is however no evidence of other land registry information available such as owner, surface, etc.

Japanese public procurement is undertaken in a decentralized way by each procuring entity on its own.
Supporting4:
Japanese public procurement is undertaken in a decentralized way by each procuring entity on its own. There is no national procurement agency or the like. Though, there are central information sources and databases for companies to search for tenders (1). There is a public procurement portal managed by the Japan External Trade Organization but there is no data on awarded contracts (2). Some Ministries provide awarded contracts information on their website. We could find such data on the following ones: Ministry of Education, Culture, Science, Sports and Technology (3), Ministry of Environment (4), Ministry of Foreign Affairs (5) and Ministry of Defense (6).

The government does not hold detailed public transport data because there is no widespread public transport system. The transport routes in Kenya's matatu and bus transport industryis dynamic with constant shifts in routes and service (1).

The website of the agency was not accessible by the time of the research (1)(2).

Digital mapping data is not available for the country. This would also be the opportunity to create a digital mapping system of the country (1)(2).

At least two agencies within the Mexican government provide health-related data. 

The National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI – www.inegi.org.mx) provides the following information in several formats.

-	Levels of vaccination available in .xls (http://www3.inegi.org.mx/sistemas/sisept/default.aspx?t=msal29&s=est&c=22556) 
-	Levels of access to health care including insured patients in public facilities (IMSS and ISSSTE) available in .xls (http://www3.inegi.org.mx/sistemas/temas/default.aspx?s=est&c=21702) 
-	Causes of death in public and private hospitals available in .xls
http://www3.inegi.org.mx/sistemas/temas/default.aspx?s=est&c=21702
-	Reasons for doctor visits and hospitalizations in public and private hospitals available in .xls 
http://www3.inegi.org.mx/sistemas/temas/default.aspx?s=est&c=21702

The National System for Health Information (Sistema Nacional de Información en Salud - http://www.sinais.salud.gob.mx/) has an open data catalogue that includes only the following information:
-	CLUES (directory of health facilities)
-	CLUES KMZ (directory of health facilities)
-	Hospital Discharges
-	Maternal Mortality
-	Births

Available here: http://www.sinais.salud.gob.mx/basesdedatos/cat_datosabiertos.html

-	Levels of access to health care including insured patients in public facilities (IMSS and ISSSTE) available in .xls (http://www3.inegi.org.mx/sistemas/temas/default.aspx?s=est&c=21702) 
-	Causes of death in public and private hospitals available in .xls

Supporting4:
All the datasets it hosts are XLS, DOC, PDF, thus not all are machine-readable.
More specifically, all the datasets relating to finances and budget are in XLS format and available on both the MoF portal (http://www.finances.gov.ma/fr/Pages/Statistiques.aspx?Active=ICCM&m=vous%20%C3%AAtes? ) and on data.gov.ma (http://www.data.gov.ma/data/fr/group/finance ).

Lastly, it is noteworthy to provide more detailed information on the Citizen Budget (Budget Citoyen, http://www.finances.gov.ma/fr/Pages/Budget-citoyen.aspx?m=Loi%20de%20finances%20et%20Budget ). It is available under PDF on the Ministry of Finances website (in French: [http://www.finances.gov.ma/Docs/2014/DB/bcfr2014.pdf](http://www.finances.gov.ma/Docs/2014/DB/bcfr2014.pdf) ; in Arabic: [http://www.finances.gov.ma/Docs/2014/DB/bcara2014.pdf](http://www.finances.gov.ma/Docs/2014/DB/bcara2014.pdf) ) and is up to date (2014).

Mozambique has one of the least developed Transport Infrastructure in the Southern African region: road density has been estimated at 0.05 kilo meters per square kilo meter(1). Mozambique’s connectivity among urban and 
economic clusters is quite limited, lacking linkages that connect parallel corridors to each other(2).The bus timetable posted by the KAYA KEWERU Shuttle service is meager and as such it cannot be considered as a transport time table(3).

Some basic statistics on accidents are provided by the National Institute of Roads [Instituto Nacional do Viaçao] (4).

Centraal Bureau voor de Statistiek (Statistics Netherlands)
Supporting4: Generally, Statistics Netherlands either offers clicking all the data through interactive tables or its open data site. In general, the site is quite helpful, however when looking for a comprehensive overview of statistical indicators, one has to click oneself through very many small steps, going through all the sub-branches of the info tree. There is no central body collecting public transportation services data. Each service/company in itself is expected to maintain its own data. For example, Lahore Transport Company (1) manages its own timetable and routes for public buses. Pakistan Railways (2) is also expected to maintain its own timetable. If any organization chooses not to collect or share this information, then there is no compulsion on them to do so.

National Mapping and Resource Information Authority (NAMRIA) (1), an office attached to the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) (2).

Supporting4:
NAMRIA produces topographic maps, aerial photographs, and satellite images.  1:250000 maps in jpg format are available for download, other maps are available under charging fee. Since 2011, the Government of Philippines also set up a geoportal using 1:250000 Topographical data from NAMRIA as its based map (1). The project was still under development and testing phase in August 2012 (2). The Open Data Portal lists the topographic map as available under a CC-BY license but the link provided does not enable to download the data (3).

The new Philippines Statistics Authority (PSA)(1), created in 2013, is still under implementation. The PSA encompasses the former National Statistics Coordination Board (2); National Statistics Office (3); Bureau of Agricultural Statistics (4); Bureau of Labor and Employment Statistics (5).

##Sources

(1) https://psa.gov.ph/ Accessed on 2014-10-27
(2) http://www.nscb.gov.ph/ Accessed on 2014-10-27
(3) http://www.census.gov.ph/ Accessed on 2014-10-27
(4) http://www.bas.gov.ph/ Accessed on 2014-10-27
(5) http://www.bles.dole.gov.ph/ Accessed on 2014-10-27
Supporting4:
The PSA website provides links to some statistical portal, including CountryStat (1) (food and agricultural information). The National Statistics Office website provides with a list of publications, but many of them, including results from the census and Statistical Yearbooks are not available online (2). The National Statistics Coordination Board provides some tables such as Gross National Income or Population but only a the national level (3). Finally, the national Open Data portal data.gov.ph contains some statistical datasets such as results from a census on poverty and housing (4). However it is worth noted the portal does not contain data on census results. It also links to datasets that are not available to download such as population 2010.

Commission on Elections (1). 

##Sources
(1) www.comelec.gov.ph Accessed on 2014-10-28
Supporting4:
The COMELEC website provides information on all national elections results (1), however there is no data for president and vice-president election. According to a National Democratic Institute 2010 elections report (2): "The law requires that precinct-level election results be posted publicly on COMELEC’s website. However, on election night, the public posting of transmission results stopped after approximately 90 percent of the results had been posted. Thus, no results were publicly released for approximately 7,500 PCOS machines. The data was soon taken down by the COMELEC. Before it was taken down, a group of IT experts created a mirror image of the site (...). This has raised serious concerns among some political contestants and civil society members."

Supporting4:
The GIS website explains: "The Centre for GIS conducts a major mapping project on a national level every 3 years which updates digital topographic data base it maintains. New products are added as technologies evolve and requirements to deliver improved services to Qatar increase." (http://www.gisqatar.org.qa/en/page2/page11/test.html). Thus, the data may as well exist yet it does not seem available online.

A number of GeoPortals are linked from the GIS website (http://www.gisqatar.org.qa/ar/page14/test.php) but none of these appeared functional at the time of research.

Qatar Ministry of Environment (1).

(1): http://www.moe.gov.qa/
Supporting4:
The MoE provides full text versions of the country's environmental legislation, news on environment related topics (workshops, details of government campaigns, e.g. whale shark campaign), links to environmental maps produced by the government, etc. The Ministry has also made available an online portal allowing the public to send messages direct to the Minister. The website is regularly updated.

Emissions of pollutants data is not available through the Ministry of Environment. (Such data is defined as “aggregate data about the emission of air pollutants, especially those potentially harmful to human health.”) On the Qatar Info Exchange website, the tabs "Air emissions", "Air pollution" and "Waste" contain no publications. See box below for direct links to these sections.

Local transportation data depends on many factors but all regions have websites for their public and private bus routes (for example, http://avtovokzal.ots56.ru/, http://www.chitaavtovokzal.ru/, http://www.yarbust.ru/, http://www.mostransavto.ru/, and dozens others). All this data is available directly and free of charge. As it is impossible to survey all these, the assessment is focused on the Railway Company website (http://pass.rzd.ru/main-pass/public/ru).

It is a tricky question to answer as it depends on the website one considers. More specifically:
- data.gov.ru: indicates that use, reuse and distribution is allowed for both any purpose, anytime, with no territorial limitation, but then goes on indicating that "the use of open data must be only for lawful purposes" and when using the data, the person has to "ensure that he does not distort the open data in their use". This is a vaguely worded thus unclear restriction, therefore is considered non-open.
- FedStat and GKS: The Agency for statistics website does not carry any copyright/license mention whatsoever, thus the data cannot be considered openly licensed. Yet, Russian legislation does not instate any restriction on data from aforementioned providers; thus, according to the current Russian legislation, there are no legal restrictions on use, reuse or redistribute statistics data and this is true despite the lack of clear copyright mention. According to Art. 1259 of Russia's Civil Сode, official government documents including laws, other legal texts, judicial decisions, other materials of legislative, administrative and judicial character are not objects of copyright.

Since two out of the three surveyed websites seem to provide openly licensed data, the indicator is considered 'Yes'.

It is a tricky question to answer as it depends on the website one considers. More specifically:
- Ministry of Interior OD page: indicates that use, reuse and distribution is allowed for both commercial and non-commercial purposes, but "the use of open data must be only for lawful purposes" and when using the data, the person has to "ensure that he does not distort the open data in their use". This is a vaguely worded thus unclear restriction, therefore is considered non-open.
- FedStat and CrimeStat: The Agency for statistics website does not carry any copyright/icense mention whatsoever, thus the data cannot be considered openly licensed. Yet, Russian legislation does not instate any restriction on data from aforementioned providers; thus, according to the current Russian legislation, there are no legal restrictions on use, reuse or redistribute statistics data and this is true despite the lack of clear copyright mention. According to Art. 1259 of Russia's Civil Сode, official government documents including laws, other legal texts, judicial decisions, other materials of legislative, administrative and judicial character are not objects of copyright.

Since two out of the three surveyed websites seem to provide openly licensed data, the indicator is considered 'Yes'.

Ministry of Justice(1).

(1): http://www.moj.gov.sa
Supporting4:
The King is at the top of the legal system. He acts as the final court of appeal and can issue pardons. There are also courts in the Kingdom. The largest are the Shari'a Courts which hear most cases in the Saudi legal system. The King is also advised by a legislative body, the Majlis Al-Shura (Consultative Council). The Shura Council is composed by 150 members all appointed by the King for four-year renewable terms. The Shura has the right to propose new laws and amend existing ones.

Ministry of Justice manages the legislation. Yet it is difficult to find the fulltext versions of KSA's laws.

http://www.saudiembassy.net/about/country-information/laws/ 
http://www.moj.gov.sa/ar-sa/Pages/judgmentsystems.aspx

Supporting1: Does not seem so. The only website hosting several law texts is the one of the Saudi Embassy in Washington D.C. (http://www.saudiembassy.net/about/country-information/laws/).

Supporting0:
According to Al-Tamimi & Co. (the largest non-affiliated law firm in the Middle East), The Realty in Kind Registration Law, issued by Royal Decree No. 6 on 9/21423H, corresponding to 24/2/2004 (RKR Law) has introduced the compulsory registration of land ownership, in two step-process, the first being: "The Ministry of Municipal and Rural Affairs will prepare cadastral maps of each property in a designated area. The Ministry of Justice will then document the rights relating to each identified property and that information will be placed in the register according to the status quo under the supervision of a competent local court judge."

Given the amount of foreigners willing to buy land and build houses in KSA, changes have been introduced (or are planned, at least): "The Economic Cities Act issued almost two months ago makes KAEC the first place where foreign nationals and companies are allowed to own property in the kingdom, the CEO said. Regulations putting the act into effect will probably be issued within a few months, he said. The new rules will also cover foreclosures, repossessions and the creation of a land registry." (Arabian Business)

Thus, one may assume that the data is collected by the government (theoretically there has to be an ongoing collection) but that it is not shared.

Elections in KSA are rare (see list of elections on the Saudi e-gov portal). The Parliament of KSA is the Consultative Assembly (Majles al-Shura), composed by 150 members appointed by the King. 

Municipal elections in Saudi Arabian towns and cities are planned for 2015. Following men-only elections in 2005 and 2011, women will be able to participate in the 2015 election. According to the e-gov portal: "[...] half of the municipal council members are chosen by elections, and the other half of members are appointed by the Minister of Municipal and Rural Affairs in terms of efficiency and eligibility."

Previous municipal elections have seen summary numbers published only (see the Statistics page below). The Ministry of Municipal and Rural Affairs maintains the Municipal Councils Elections website where results are published.

Financial Intelligence Unit
Committee for the Promotion of Virtue and the Prevention of Vice
Ministry of Interior
Supporting4:
Depends on the type of crime one considers. KSA has low criminality although some researchers have expressed concern that complaints are resolved outside formal judicial institutions and as a consequence remain undocumented by the police.

Thus, for ex., money laundering and illegal cash flows are surveyed by the Financial Intelligence Unit while enforcing traditional Islamic morality in the Kingdom is ensured by the Committee for the Promotion of Virtue and the Prevention of Vice.

The available data is of very limited scope so analysis is impossible. No data is available on exam results (neither regional nor national level); no data is available on textbook availability or school resources. Some data is available on budgets, but only at a ministry level for male and female sections.

The Statistics Institute provides a data portal (1) from where it is possible to select and download series of economic and demographic statistics from 1970 to 2015 (projection). There is also a dedicated website for the general census of the population realized in 2013 (2) but it only contains preliminary and unconsolidated results. Finally the Institute also has an archives portal that lists some important statistics datasets but there only the metadata are available (3). According to the access policy data can only be reused by members of the National Statistics System.

The Surveys and Lands department (division) from the Ministry of Land, Country Planning and Environment is primarily responsible for the surveying and mapping of all lands (1). In the Western Area, the Office of the Administrator and Registrar General (OARG), a department of the Office of the Attorney General and Minister of Justice, is responsible for the General Registry which registers transaction relating to land such as deeds, leases, mortgages, etc.(2)

##Sources
(1) Public Sector Reform Unit of Sierra Leone, Management and Functional review of the Ministry of Lands, Country Planning, and the Environment, 2010, p24,  http://psru.gov.sl/sites/default/files/sites/default/files/reports/MIN%20OF%20LANDS%20and%20COUNTRY%20PLANNING%202010.pdf Accessed on 2014-09-01
(2) Office of the Administrator and Registrar General, http://www.oarg.gov.sl/Land%20Registry.html Accessed on 2014-09-01
Supporting1:
The Minister of Land, Country Planning and Environment is committed to developing a biometric registration of land to satisfy ownership claim and security of ownership. The Ministry is also in the process of undertaking a geospatial survey in partnership with multilateral companies to identify and demarcate the country’s natural resource capacity for the provision of a development plan (1). "There is currently no system of registration of titles in Sierra Leone. The Registration of Instruments Act, Cap 256 of the Laws of Sierra Leone 1960 created a system of registration of instruments of conveyance. In this system, it is the conveyance itself which confers title, not the registration of the instruments under which the conveyance was executed" (2). Lastly, according to the OARG, the Government is in the process of adopting a new land policy that will make for the introduction of a land title registration system where in it is envisaged that the western area will be a pilot project (3).

##Sources

(1) Alpha Bedoh Kamara, Africa Young Voices (AYV), As Residents and officials Praise Hon. Musa Tarawallie Lands Ministry Changes for the Better, published on  April 7th, 2014 ( http://africayoungvoices.com/2014/04/as-residents-and-officials-praise-hon-musa-tarawallie-lands-ministry-changes-for-the-better/ accessed on 31st May 2014)
(2) DFID Sierra Leone by Shaun Williams assisted by Pamela Oredola-Davies, Freetown (2006), SCOPING STUDY LAND AND PRO-POOR CHANGE IN SIERRA LEONE - http://www.britishcouncil.org/land-and-pro-poor-change-in-sierra-leone.pdf accessed on 29th July 2014
(3) Office of the Administrator and Registrar General, http://www.oarg.gov.sl/Land%20Registry.html Accessed on 2014-09-01

According to a Tourist Guide Book, public transport system in the country is sparse and timetables are rough approximations. Department of Environmental Affairs
Supporting4:
The South Africa Air Quality Information System (SAAQIS) was launched in 2010 by the Department of Environmental Affairs (1) and is run by the South Africa Weather Service.

SAAQIS, provides a common platform for managing air quality information in South Africa. It makes data available to stakeholders including the public and provides a mechanism to ensure uniformity in the way air quality data is managed i.e. captured, stored, validated, analysed and reported on in South Africa.

There is also data on the Environment GIS website and it is provided in form of Maps and graphics. It is a GIS inventory of all protected and conservation areas in South Africa. The database, which is currently being developed, will eventually also include data on privately owned protected areas. The database distinguishes between various types and sub-types of protected areas and conservation areas. Protected area types include: National Parks, Nature Reserves, Special Nature Reserves, Mountain Catchment Areas, World Heritage Sites Protected Environments, Forest Nature Reserves, Forest Wilderness Areas, Specially Protected Forest Areas and Marine Protected Areas. 

(1): http://www.gov.za/speeches/view.php?sid=8773

None of the material or information may be copied, reproduced, distributed, republished, downloaded, displayed, posted or transmitted in any form or by any means, including, but not limited to, electronic, mechanical, photocopying, recording, or otherwise unless in terms of the Terms and Conditions of use of this website".

Some individual operators (e.g. MetroRail - http://www.metrorail.co.za/Timetables.html) do provide Excel versions of their timetables, but in layouts that suggest these are intended for print rather than for use as data. These datasets were incorrectly used in the 2013 ODB to suggest detailed machine-readable public transport timetables were available in South Africa.

There is no any indication about open licence of the data or information on public transport time table. However, there are copyrights. For example, 
Rea Vaya retains copyright in the website and all current and future content that is displayed on the website, which is not owned by third parties. In terms of a limited license, granted for general use, Rea Vaya grants you, the user, subject to these terms and conditions, a non-exclusive, non-transferable, limited and revocable right to access, display, use, download and otherwise copy the current and future content of the website for your personal, non-commercial and informational purposes only. The website owner grants the user the permission to copy and distribute the information from the website provided that it notifies the webmaster of such use and provided that the source of the information is acknowledged by reference to the source. The website and content may not be reproduced, duplicated, copied, resold or otherwise exploited for any commercial purpose without the express, prior written consent of Rea Vaya.

Also, for the case of City of Cape Town website there is a copyright notice. It states that  "This website and its content is copyright of the City of Cape Town - © City of Cape Town 2008. All rights are reserved. Any redistribution or reproduction of part or all of the contents in any form is prohibited, other than the following: you may print or download to a local hard disk extracts for your personal and non-commercial use only you may copy the content to individual third parties for their personal use, but only if you acknowledge our website as the source of the material
You may not, except with our express written permission, distribute or commercially explore the content. Should such permission be granted, then each such reference must acknowledge that the information resides at and is the property of the City of Cape Town. The information created by the City of Cape Town on this site is the property of the City. 
Unless otherwise specified, permission to include URL references to this information  for non-commercial purposes is granted, provided that each such reference acknowledges that the information resides at and is the property of the City of Cape Town.

INE's license. It forbids to denaturalize the intention of the data, which makes it not open: it goes against any "accessible" principle that data should we made available to the widest range of purposes. It is unclear what original intention the data has, so it is ambiguous to claim that someone "denaturalized" it.

All the information about legislation is publicly available through the Spanish Official Bulletin (BOE) (1) as PDF or HTML. Furthermore all regions have their own official bulletin so regional legislation (2) (3) or particular implementations of an act are also available in the different regional bulletins. In conclusion, the Spanish government, ministries and regional/local governments are the ones in charge of publishing legislation.

Direction fédérale des mensurations cadastrales, Office fédéral de topographie swisstopo (1) is responsible for the provision of cadastral data at federal level.

##Sources
(1) http://www.cadastre.ch/internet/cadastre/fr/home.html Accessed on 2014-10-01
Supporting4:
There is no land registry at national (federal) level only at states level. However there is the development of a Web Map Service for Land registry (WMS-MO), a project which involve the provision of data of the cadastral survey (data MO) via a WMS (Web Map Service). This is a project of the e-geo "Geoservices Cantons" under the guidance of the Conference of Cantonal geoinformation Switzerland (CCGEO) and conducted in collaboration with the Conference of Cantonal Cadastre (CSCC) (1). It is also already possible to access available parcels boundaries via a Cadastral Web Map (2), however related land registry data will be only available trough the WMS-MO restricted service.  There is also an ongoing project eGris (3) that will provide an electronic real estate information system (eGRIS) for the country by end of 2014. 

##Sources
(1) http://www.cadastre.ch/internet/cadastre/fr/home/products/webmap/wms.html Accessed on 2014-10-01
(2) http://www.cadastre.ch/internet/cadastre/fr/home/products/webmap/cwm.html Accessed on 2014-10-01
(3) Roadmap E-Government Switzerland, November 19th 2013, http://www.egovernment.ch/umsetzung/00852/index.html?lang=en Accessed on 2014-10-01

Supporting1: No, only base map with cadastral parcels is available as a Web Map Service and provides pictures in png format (see example of request here http://bit.ly/1vwZd9V)

Supporting4:
Swiss-Impex is the database of Swiss foreign trade statistics. The application allows access to the monthly statistical data on Swiss imports and exports from 1988 onwards according to the following domains: tariff number, nature of goods, broad economic category, SITC and trading partner. The requests are limited to 10000 cells result for basic version. The expert version contains the domains canton, mode of transport, customs revenue and indices in addition to the domains contained in the basic version. This version allows for major requests and offers numerous other functions (1). The Swiss Federal Statistical Office provides aggregated data in reusable format for imports and exports from 1990 to 2013 (2).

(1) http://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/portal/de/index/themen/06/05/blank/data.html Accessed on 2014-10-01

The National Bureau of Statistics in Tanzania has made shapefiles, based on the 2012 National Census, available. These were incorrectly assessed in 2013 as meeting the definition of a national map.
Supporting4:

The Mapping Section is one of four core sections of SMD. Its major responsibility is map production. The core function of the Mapping Section is the preparation of base maps for urban and rural areas. The main mode of preparation of maps is by analogue methods. Digital mapping is progressively being introduced with the aim of phasing out analogue methods which are inefficient and inflexible to changes and cannot fully meet the ever changing and more diversified Customer needs. Introduction of digital mapping technology is progressing procuring new equipment/systems hand in hand with training of staff on full utilization of the technology.http://www.ardhi.go.tz/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=258&Itemid=333

Ministry for Environment and Water
Supporting4:
Data releases from the Ministry for Environment and Water are exclusively related to animal wealth, fisheries, and agricultural output. While there are several government and non-government organisations involved in environmental awareness programs and community action programs, activities are generally in areas such as energy consumption, marine debris, waste reduction, and paper consumption. Furthermore, no information on carbon emissions, emission of pollutants (e.g. carbon monoxides, nitrogen oxides, particulate matter etc.), and deforestation was identified. These areas of intervention are not currently the focus of Ministry for Environment and Water open data releases, and, therefore, cannot be attributed to current environmental open data initiatives. 

Ministry for Environment and Water. (2014). Statistics http://www.moew.gov.ae/Portal/en/knowledge-and-statistics/statistics.aspx#page=1

Ministry of Lands, Housing and Urban Development
Department Of Land Registration
http://www.mlhud.go.ug/aboutus.html
Supporting4:
The Land Registry runs on a manual system of record keeping, though government has piloted the Computerized Land Register and Land Information System. This is an attempt to address the issue of the disorganized registry and enable an expedited storage, access and retrieval of land records to enhance service delivery. the Permanent Secretary in the Ministry of Lands, Housing & Urban Development points out that for the moment the registry still relies on the ‘human factor’ because putting the system in place and sustaining it is not cheap (1).

There is also evidence that the Ministry of Lands, Housing and Urban Development has data sets on land ownership though it is not published. For example, This is evident by the Land Information system in Masaka district where some land titles were no entered into the system as result of incomplete information on their land. Here is the link - http://www.mlhud.go.ug/publicnotices/phploaderLIS%20Masaka%20PROBLEMATIC%20FILES.pdf.php

(1) Gabindadde Musoke, 31st May 2013, “Computerizing the Uganda land registry”
http://www.independent.co.ug/column/comment/7838-computerising-the-uganda-land-registry

Supporting4:
A large number of datasets (200+) is provided by the Department of Health on data.gov.uk. A lot of these datasets are on medical statistics, such as the prevalence of a certain disease. In terms of performance data, there seem to be some discontinuities on data.gov.uk - a datasets such as "NHS Inpatient and Outpatient Waiting Times, England" was last updated in 2011, containing data for 2010. A test for all DoH datasets containing 'waiting' delivered datasets with data from late 2012 in the most recent case. This might have to do with update cycles, also weekly data such as "A&E weekly" (3) contained the "week ending 17 March 2013" as most recent part. However, this has to do with the search mechanism. If one also chooses "Include datasets from sub-publishers", far more recent datasets are displayed (4). In some cases the publisher changes between DoH and NHS, as in (5) and (6).
NHS-related entries lead to specific NHS sites instead of allowing direct csv downloads.

In general: Yes, very sustainable. In particular, links that generate the most recent version of monthly or yearly statistics in the desired format are very smart. (1)

(1) http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/datasets-and-tables/downloads/csv.csv?dataset=lms

(A side note on sustainability of data.gov.uk: At a first look, http://data.gov.uk/dataset/quarterly_national_accounts for the GDP appears as a bulk download possibility. However, the overview site does not lead to data, but to archived ONS sites. Access to data is only possible for the recent 2 years (until  Q4 2011) - yet most of the data is covered in the most recent version of the quarterly views of the GDP.)

As selecting proper datasets in this area involves searching and looking through a lot of statistics, it was a bit difficult. For instance, data.gov.uk doesn't deliver any direct data links when looking for 'census 2011', only links to the ONS's specific sites (i.e. http://data.gov.uk/dataset/2011_census_). From these sites, following the links to 'reference tables' actually leads to data. Also it takes some time to understand that a lot of statistics don't only include a snapshot of, for instance, the labour market in a specific month, but range back more than 20 year. So the most recent version also is a bulk data version. However, a yearly version cannot be found in this cases.

The agency in charge of this information is the State Contracts and Purchases Agency (Agencia de Compras y Contrataciones del Estado), which depends of the Presidency of the Republic. The site includes an online query system and the information is publicly available there. A few datasets (mostly regarding procedures and standards) are available at the government open data catalog. Even though the full databases are not directly available online it is possible to program a bot (or do it one by one)and query the online service and get the data. 

The process of integration of public contracts and purchases in the system is ongoing but not yet complete, and some public organizations have been slow to adapt to it. This means that not every public contract and purchase is included in the system nowadays.

(1) https://www.comprasestatales.gub.uy/, accessed June 13th, 2014.
(2) https://catalogodatos.gub.uy/organization/acce, accessed June 13th, 2014.

The agency in charge of this dataset is the Elections Court (Corte Electoral), which is the national elections authority. Information is comprehensive and shared, and the institution's website creates special sections and subsites for access to information when there are elections (this was the case at the moment this survey was conducted). It is possible to access the data online and in some cases registration is needed for live connections. The data is not published as Open Data though.

Supporting0: The main governmental agency responsible for crime statistics is the Ministry of Interior, which maintains and online observatory where it publishes information in the form of periodic reports (annual and by six month period). These reports are in pdf format and refer to general aggregated data and indicators. Direct access to data at a more granular level is not public and may or not be collected. Additional information can be found at the "Seguridad ciudadana" section of the "Observatorio Social" of the Ministry of Social Development, where complementary data on some specific issues (e.g gender violence) can be found.

Data about primary and secondary education performance in Uruguay is collected and maintained by several governmental actors, lacking a central unit that comprehensively aggregates and shares data. The closest to that is the National Institute for Evaluation of Education (Instituto Nacional de Evaluación Educativa - INEED - whose board is formed by members of the Ministry of Education and Culture, the National Education Administration and one representative of private institutions and one for the public University). 

Basic indicators data is collected and shared at the websites of the different institutions involved in the complex governance of education in Uruguay. Some of these are also posted at the websites of Office for Planning and Budget and the Ministry of Social Develpment (MIDES). These general datasets are usually posted in proprietary formats like Microsoft Excel. It is important to note that actual performance datasets that include microdata are collected but not publicly shared.

The main agencies in charge of emissions and other environmental data in Uruguay are the Ministry of Housing, Territorial Planning and Environment (Ministerio de Vivienda, Ordenamiento Territorial y Medio Ambiente -MVOTMA-)and the Ministry of Livestock, Agriculture and Fisheries (Ministerio de Ganadería, Agricultura y Pesca -MGAP-). Both minisitries have units directly in charge of data and publish it regularly at their websites. The MVOTMA site includes a few visualization tools for some topics like protected areas or coastal regions.The information available is usually in proprietary formats like excel or through annual reports in pdf form. Some selected indicators are also available at other general information websites, like the MIDES social observatory website (environment section) or the MDG reports.

Supporting1:
Citing the OKF Open Data Index: "In the US, corporate registration happens at the state level. The timeliness, availability, and licensing of this data varies among all 50 states. There is no federal dataset that contains all corporate registrations. It would be possible to create a unified open registry for all US corporations (even if only via aggregation from state ones) but this does not exist at this time"

Contributors to this entry are Kaitlin Devine, Laura James (Editors); Jeanne Holm (Submitters). I met Jeanne recently on a conference and as Evangelist of Data.gov she should give a trustworthy account.

I had a short Twitter-conversation with OpenCorporates and confirmed that there is still no dataset on a national level.

The most accessible system on awarded contracts appears to be USAspending.gov, run by the Office of Management and Budget.
For contract opportunities it's Federal Business Opportunities (FedBizOpps).
Supporting4:
According to a report by the Congressional Research Service, the Federal government uses a variety fo acquisition systems, including Acquisition Central, Electronic Subcontracting Reporting System (eSRS), Federal Business Opportunities (FedBizOpps), Federal Funding Accountability and Transparency Act (FFATA) Portal, Federal Procurement Data System-Next Generation (FPDS-NG), Federal Awardee Performance and Integrity Information System (FAPIIS), FFATA Sub-Award Reporting System (FSRS), Interagency Contract Directory (ICD), Past Performance Information Retrieval System (PPIRS), System for Award Management (SAM), USAspending.gov, and Wage Determinations On-line (WDOL). This is not exactly easy to cope with if one is mainly looking for some easily accessible datasets. In addition, the report states: "Over the years, questions have been raised regarding the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of the contract award data available from FPDS and its successor, FPDS-NG." (1)

The report features an overview of the acquisition systems on page 8 (2)

(1) L. Elaine Halchin: Transforming Government Acquisition Systems: Overview and Selected Issues, June 2013 - http://fas.org/sgp/crs/misc/R43111.pdf
(2) http://fas.org/sgp/crs/misc/R43111.pdf#8

Supporting4:
The data can be downloaded in form of prime awards and sub-awards and allows filtering by agency, fiscal year(*), recipient state, place of performance state, and records submitted since. Also, the spending data can be selected by contracts, grants, loans, direct payments, insurance or other. 'contracts' is the only category directly relevant for our survey. Also the level of detail can be chosen between 'basic' and 'complete'. The amount of entries when selecting all contracts for 2014 with basic infos is very large. I had so slim down the time range to one week in order to retrieve less than 65.000 entries.

(*) Fiscal years start in October 1 and end in September 30, i.e. fiscal year 2014 ends on September 30, 2014.

According to the Law of Public Registry and Notarizing (Ley de Registro Público y del Notariado)(1)company registration should be done before State Business offices (Oficinas de Registro Mercantil). 

Nonetheless, the  Ministerio del Poder Popular para Industrias (2) runs the Management Integrated System for Industry and Commerce (Sistema Integral de Gestión para las Industrias y el Comercio) (3) in which companies must also register. 

Additionaly, the Ministerio del Poder Popular para el Comercio (4) via their office Fair Prices Superintendency (Superintendencia de Precios Justos)(5) runs the Unique Registry for People who develops economic activities  
Registro Único de Personas que desarrollan actividades económicas - RUPDAE)(6).  

However, none of this public offices make their data publicy available via internet.

The National Assembly publishes projects of law in legislative agenda as well as final text of approved laws. (1)
Just 9 laws appeared as approved in 2013, none from 2014 is published. Approved laws are published in .pdf format. 
Projects of law on legislative agenda are not longer available on the web. They used to be published until 2012. 

All enacted laws, as well as Executive government decrees must be published in the Gaceta Oficial. Official website for the Gaceta Oficial domain expired. Gaceta Oficial is printed every working day. 

Last update of the Gaceta Oficial within the National Assembly website was on March 21, 2014. (2)

The Tribunal Supremo de Justicia keeps publishing Gaceta Oficial text on .pdf format. (3) Last update was on June 6, 2014.

In Vietnam, there is no definition "Land ownership", there is only "land usage right" (1). When you want to pay money to get the "land usage right", you have to go to the local office of the government and pay to see the map of registered land to know if it is legal to buy the rights or not. 

##Source: 

http://vietnamembassy-usa.org/basic-page/land-regulations  - No.1 Land Use Rights and Land Use Right Certificate
Supporting4:
There are some official sources depending on provinces that you can track the data about land usage right in the area you need (1).  In other places, you have to go the local office to be able to see the exact information about land usage that relates the area that you are concerned about.

The division of Land Information Management System is a department of the Ministry of Lands, Land Reform and Resettlement established to provide adequate Lands Information to the Agricultural sector. Supporting4:
The Zimbabwe Republic Police is responsible for sharing information on crimes statistics. However, there is no website for the agency

The Zimbabwe National Statistics Agency publishes crimes statistics through the Zimbabwe Prisons and Correctional Services (ZPCS) collects information on prisons admissions and discharges on a monthly basis. Data are collected using the Admissions and Discharge/Release questionnaires. The information is used to measure and assess changes in crime trends and prison population characteristics.  The crimes statistics is characterized by crimes by age, reliegion of belief, sex, marital status, etc
